question: Match the following:
column_II: Free-nuclear endosperm with thousands of nuclei
Remains in mature seed (e.g., castor, coconut)

matches.right: Free-nuclear endosperm with thousands of nuclei
Remains in mature seed (e.g., castor, coconut)

answer: Free-nuclear endosperm → Stage before cell wall formation, Cellular endosperm → Endosperm after cell wall formation, Coconut water → Free-nuclear endosperm with thousands of nuclei, Coconut kernel → Cellular endosperm in coconut, Persistent endosperm → Remains in mature seed (e.g., castor, coconut)

question: Match the following:
column_II: Consumed before seed maturation (e.g., pea, bean)
Similar in monocots and dicots initially

matches.right: Consumed before seed maturation (e.g., pea, bean)
Similar in monocots and dicots initially

answer: Non-persistent endosperm → Consumed before seed maturation (e.g., pea, bean), Zygote location → Micropylar end of embryo sac, Embryogeny → Similar in monocots and dicots initially, Epicotyl → Above cotyledons, ends in plumule, Hypocotyl → Below cotyledons, ends in radicle

question: Match the following:
column_II: Stage before mature embryo in dicots

matches.right: Stage before mature embryo in dicots

answer: Proembryo → First stage after zygote division, Globular stage → Early spherical embryo stage, Heart-shaped stage → Stage before mature embryo in dicots, Scutellum → Single cotyledon in grasses, Root cap → Covers root tip
